selrach.bnetbuilder.model.distributions.conditional
Class ConditionalTable

java.lang.Object
  selrach.bnetbuilder.model.distributions.conditional.AbstractConditionalDistribution
      selrach.bnetbuilder.model.distributions.conditional.Mixture
          selrach.bnetbuilder.model.distributions.conditional.ConditionalTable
All Implemented Interfaces:
ConditionalDistribution
public class ConditionalTable
extends Mixture

This is a distribution for a discrete variable with only discrete parents.

Author:
Charles Robertson

Constructor Summary

          Creates a deep copy of the conditional table

Method Detail

normalize

public void normalize()
Normalizes all the tables in this distribution

setProbability

public void setProbability(int[] parentState,
                           int[] currentState,
                           double probability)
                    throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
Sets the probability for one set of variables,

Parameters:
parentStateIndex - This is the index corresponding to the parent we wish to set...Its as if you had flattened out the possible settings for this variable. So if you had 3 parents with 3 states apiece, this value goes from [0, 26]. Its your job to make sure the ordering is consistent whenever you access this. This function does not do normalizing, this is your responsibility. For a more massive set, use setProbability(parentStateIndex, probabilities) as it will be faster and will do normalizing
currentState - the state of this distribution you want to set the probability for.
probability - the probability you want to set.
Throws:
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException

setProbability

public void setProbability(int[] parentState,
                           cern.colt.matrix.DoubleMatrix1D probabilities)
Sets the all the probabilities associated with a particular parent setting

Parameters:
parentStateIndex - This is the index corresponding to the parent we wish to set...Its as if you had flattened out the possible settings for this variable. So if you had 3 parents with 3 states apiece, this value goes from [0, 26]. Its your job to make sure the ordering is consistent whenever you access this. This function does not do normalizing, this is your responsibility. For a more massive set, use setProbability(parentStateIndex, probabilities) as it will be
probabilities - probabilities you want to assign, this will be normalized after being set.
